name: Pestana Sintra Golf Resort and Spa Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like American style hotels (ie. Sheraton, Westin, Marriott) that are spacious & have the amenities of four star hotels, you'll definitely like this place. There's no nickeling and diming you for internet service or parking. Wi-fi is available for free and voucher for a free drink per person at the bar (beer, wine or port). We stayed one night on May 30, 2010 since we were flying out the next day from Lisbon. We decided to stay near Sintra to visit the sites. The air is very fresh (a tad bit cooler) since you're in a "higher" elevation. The resort is very clean and of an excellent standard. Our room faced the golf-course and there were two? pools (very nice!). The hotel was not super busy so it was not noisy at all. I didn't try the spa but the price list was very reasonable. It is a very short drive to downtown historical area (5-10 minutes) so I definitely recommend staying here if you're planning on visiting Sintra.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
Very clean, modern and functional
reviews.text: rooms comfortable and clean, staff was very helpful, great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I actually own a flat in the close off district of Quinta da Beloura 1 but still decided to spend one night with my wife in the Pestana Hotel next door. The location of the hotel is fabulous with amazing views over the Sintra mountain. The swimming pool is nice, the spa enjoyable, the restaurant good, the staff pleasant and helpful. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are nice. We got a nice balcony with view of the mountain, with a nice table a two chairs. There is a 18 h golf course. Good value for money, in particular if you find a last minute deal as we did.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel with amazing views. Great for Golf lovers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has beautiful Moorish architecture. It is new, clean and modern and has great facilities. I highly recommend it. All rooms have 2 levels. Downstairs is the bathroom, small kitchen, and living area with desk. Upstairs is the bedroom which can be a bit inconvenient if you have to use the facilities at night. Most rooms have balconies. The bar is beautifully decorated and it’s a nice place to get a drink. The indoor pool is heated. Only complaint is that it is a bit understaffed. At the front desk there is usually only one person and that usually means waiting a while to get assistance. It is far out of the city so you will probably need a car to see the sites of Sintra. Free parking was nice.
reviews.title: Nice place to rest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pestana Sintra with our two kids (5&16). The hotel is modern, and was inaugurated in October 2006. It is clean and the rooms (we got two superior rooms) are large and well furnished. The indoor swimming pool is great, but the temperature was not favourable for us to check the outdoor pool. They have a good Spa with good treatments, but pricey. The breakfast was pretty good, with a selection of hot and cold food, and a good variety of pastries. We only dined at the hotel twice, and on both nights they had a buffet, which in my view was overpriced and uninteresting – you’re better off checking out some of the very unpretentious traditional restaurants in Sintra and neighbouring areas, as we did on the other nights, but with a small daughter the convenience of the hotel was didn’t go out very night. Having travelled a bit in Portugal, I think the Northerners are more friendly and polite, but the staff at the hotel was mostly fine, with the exception of the lady doing physiotherapy treatments in the pool, which clearly shouldn’t be in the service sector.
reviews.title: great hotel
